text: Hi, I am new to HubSpot, I had a question, I have a react web application and wanted to track visitors on it, will dropping the tracking code in my head tag work? as in it will track page views, form events, video events ... all of them without doing anything additional?

<@U051UA09W6B> In your case you will have to <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code#tracking-in-single-page-applications|let the tracking script know> when a new page is viewed.
<@U051U23LBKP> Custom post types isn’t available in HubSpot. Depending on your subscription, you can use HubDB to create something similar.

After adding tracking code in my website, the _<http://js.hs-scripts.com|js.hs-scripts.com>_ script is loading(getting 200 Ok response), but the script after it <http://js.hs-analytics.net|js.hs-analytics.net> is not loading correctly, getting no response. If I use the link, in another window I am able to get the js file. Is the previous error due to a cors situation how to resolve it?

Hi <@U051U23LBKP>,

There is no specific way to add a custom post type in HubSpot, but you can add various blog types that function similarly to a custom post type of WordPress.

A Different blog type come with a unique URL, listing page, and other features.

Although WordPress tag features are more flexible, But you can still do almost everything with HubSpot.

Anyone knows why Hs_Default_Custom_Style.css is loaded on my website? I use coded (DND) templates, but do not include this stylesheet anywhere. I do not have this stylesheet on other HS websites I build.

hey guys,

im not sure if this is the right channel for this questions but Im looking to build a react tool and add to my website which is built using HS CMS. Is that possible to have the react landing page hosted in another server to have an URL like this <http://mysite.com/react-landingpage|mysite.com/react-landingpage>?

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!

Hi,
We have a client that needs the ability to verify a user before they can register on HubSpot. Here is the scenario, the client has a list of potential students for an online course. We have a list of students including their first name, last name, DOB, and unique user ID (no email address). When the student registers they will enter their first name, last name, DOB, and ID. We need to match the elements with a list, if they do not match they need to be notified. If they do match, then we pass on the information to a list of validated students. Has anyone ever dealt with a scenario like this and if so how did you solve it?  Feel free to DM me with any solutions or ideas. Thanks!
Yeah you can definitely setup a workflow to do this
We went down that track, without an email address to match against it looks like it will not work.
So you're saying that the client will pick the students, and then you want to send an email to the client letting them know if they entered a student info incorrectly?

The client will have a list of students that does not have the student email address. When the student registers we need to make sure the fields match the list the client has. Without an email address to use  to match the record HubSpot cannot validate against the other fields.
You can definitely match fields together in HubSpot using the search api and a workflow...
how would we use the search API? Do you have time for a quick call?

hi <@U022YD6LGAU>, thanks for explaining, if I am not using standard HubSpot templates and global headers that could deemed to be problematic using a B-variant menu, is there any documentation on how to use B-variant menus in templates?
